body_html:
(pasting my comments from the now deprecated version for visibility)

  • Basically, I am mainly concerned about the complexity that project() introduces to the codebase. I do not have problem with the add_library(... object) settings.

  • it might be possible to do a codemod to improve the codebase's -W settings in general, but that is not a blocking item.

  • for inclusion paths, same directory includes should also use absolute path too in order to have a consistent setting. See https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
body_text:
(pasting my comments from the now deprecated version for visibility)


Basically, I am mainly concerned about the complexity that project() introduces to the codebase. I do not have problem with the add_library(... object) settings.


it might be possible to do a codemod to improve the codebase's -W settings in general, but that is not a blocking item.


for inclusion paths, same directory includes should also use absolute path too in order to have a consistent setting. See https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
body:
(pasting my comments from the now deprecated version for visibility)

- Basically, I am mainly concerned about the complexity that project() introduces to the codebase. I do not have problem with the add_library(... object) settings.

- it might be possible to do a codemod to improve the codebase's -W settings in general, but that is not a blocking item.

- for inclusion paths, same directory includes should also use absolute path too in order to have a consistent setting. See https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
